Class RandomTree

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread

All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
Direct Known Subclasses:
RandomTree2d
public abstract class RandomTree
extends ScheduledThread

Base class for trees.

Thomas Weber

grow

public void grow(Sampler<Dataset> sampler,
                 int maxDepth)
          throws java.lang.Exception
Grows the tree.

Attention: If multithreading is activated, you have to care about progress before proceeding with testing etc., i.e. you can use the isGrown() method for that purpose.

Parameters:
sampler - contains the whole data to train the tree.
mode - 0: root node (no preceeding classification), 1: left, 2: right; -1: out of bag
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

growRec

protected void growRec(RandomTree root,
                       Sampler<Dataset> sampler,
                       java.util.List<Classification> classification,
                       long count,
                       Node node,
                       int mode,
                       int depth,
                       int maxDepth,
                       boolean multithreading)
                throws java.lang.Exception
Internal: Grows the tree.

Parameters:
sampler - contains the whole data to train the tree.
mode - 0: root node (no preceeding classification), 1: left, 2: right; -1: out of bag
multithreading - this is used to disable the threading part, if called from the run method. Otherwise, an infinite loop would happen with multithreading.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

evaluateFeaturesThreaded

protected void evaluateFeaturesThreaded(RandomTree root,
                                        Sampler<Dataset> sampler,
                                        java.util.List<java.lang.Object> paramSet,
                                        java.util.List<Classification> classification,
                                        long count,
                                        int mode,
                                        float[][] thresholds,
                                        long[][][] countClassesLeft,
                                        long[][][] countClassesRight,
                                        Node node,
                                        int depth)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
Evaluates a couple of features with a couple of thresholds. This method just controls the thread behaviour of feature evaluation. The CPU-intensive calculation takes place in abstract method evaluateFeatures().

Parameters:
sampler -
paramSet -
classification -
mode -
thresholds -
countClassesLeft -
countClassesRight -
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

getGainsByEntropy

protected double[][] getGainsByEntropy(int paramSetSize,
                                       long[][][] countClassesLeft,
                                       long[][][] countClassesRight)
Info gain calculation upon shannon entropy, Kinect formula.

getEntropy

public static double getEntropy(long[] counts)
Calculates shannon entropy for a binary alphabet (two possible values), while a and b represent the count of each of the two "letters".

Parameters:
a -
b -
counts - delivers the counts for each "letter" of the alphabet.
Returns:
public static double getBinaryEntropy(final long a, final long b) { long all = a+b; if(all <= 0) return 0; double pa = (double)a/all; double pb = (double)b/all; return - pa * (Math.log(pa)/LOG2) - pb * (Math.log(pb)/LOG2); } /** Calculates shannon entropy.

run

public void run()
Wraps the growRec() method for multithreaded tree growing, using the instance attributes postfixed with "newThread". Represents an "anonymous" RandomTree instance to wrap the growRec method. Results have to be watched with the isGrown method of the original (root) RandomTree instance.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
Overrides:
run in class java.lang.Thread

                    long[][][] countClassesLeft,
                    long[][][] countClassesRight,
                    int winner,
                    int winnerThreshold)
             throws java.lang.Exception
